Message.Title: THE PERFECT FIT FOR RIMM IS BIG BLUE
Message.Msg: Rimm has a lots to offer for ibm, not just the enterprise business unit. Reasonable offer over $25/share for the entire company perhaps is doable go for it big blue. Blue beery sound very sweet.

Message.Title: BLACK BERRY SHOULD BE A BLUEBERRY, GO FOR IT IBM, RIMM IS SO CHEAP, IBM CAN EASILY COMPETE WITH APPL

IBM can really compete with like of AAPL. Samsung. This would be the deal of century. I hope this Lady at IBM will make it happens.

Topic.Title: China slowdown -- is IBM a short idea here?

Message.Msg: "China is slowing down on Europe. Is IBM going to be hit by both China and Europe?" What I look for in IBM is stability. This year, the word from some was that IBM's Q2 would be soft and that the tax settlement break in Q1, which offset a big charge for employee separation and re-org and was the cause of the Q1 beat, meant that the rest of the year would be soft. But we are at a $15.10 boggy. As to a China slowdown this year, IBM has its supply chain operations in China and does a lot of business there resulting in a big staff of employees and consultants. I would expect that IBM would know what is happening in China well before and more accurately than many talking heads on CNBC. IBM proved it's new model in 2009, which can bring earnings and cash flow to the bottom line even if revenue is clocking in reverse. I'm somewhat hedged and not a seller. I'll go with the $15.10 for now.

Topic.Title: IBM should acquire entire RIMM, Not only tne Enterprise Bus unit

Message.Msg: Buy all of Rimm and break the company up. IBM Global Services could easily run the software server business, the network and the software development. Then sell the hand set side of the business to Lenovo, like IBM did to the pc’s.

Topic.Title: IBM should acquire entire RIMM, Not only tne Enterprise Bus unit

Message.Msg: RIMM has a market cap of $5 billion, and they are a dying business. RIMM was crushed by AAPL and GOOG. Buying any part of them would be like HPQ buying PALM...no bueno!

Message.Title: Daily Vol.
Message.Msg: I am not sure what it mens but the daily sales volumn has been decreasing fron over 6 million a day to a current average of about 4 million. The last few weeks has seen volumns in the range of 1 to 2 million. Is this due to the lack of sellers that expect highr stock prices in the future or the lack of byers that feel the stock is overpriced. Your opiniion.

Topic.Title: IBM should acquire entire RIMM, Not only tne Enterprise Bus unit

Message.Msg: IBM blows with consumer devices. They have no business getting into the smartphone foray. Running the plumbing...yes.
That is why we need to get rid of all of the Democrats in Congress that we can get rid of.
Ron Paul for President

Topic.Title: IBM should acquire entire RIMM, Not only tne Enterprise Bus unit

Message.Msg: Ginny Rometty became IBM 's CEO because she championed the $3.5 bil acquisition of price Water house Consulting, and then restructured IBM's marketing and sales organization with the talent acquired with PWC. She is good. All indications are that IBM will not be getting in the generic smart-phone biz. A wild card reason for buying the whole thing might be to get some patents that could be valuable. IBM has pioneered systems to organize patents as well as do searches constantly to find possible infringements. It sells these services so if IBM sees patent value they could buy RIMM in total for patents or other valuable assets to IBM. Competing directly with AAPL & GOOG & MSFT in smart-phones would not be part of the plan. Let Meg Whitman at HPQ do that.
The only way for Mitt to save the Country is for him to slit his Mormon / Cult throat.
